Thank you YIFY!
The film doesn't look very good. But the source material is supposed to be the problem. As the reviewer at blu-ray com said, "The bulk of the film was shot on a Canon DV camcorder... there is a lot of edge enhancement and grain, the picture appears extremely soft and blurred, and there is very little detail."
You notice that the final part, shot in 35mm, has much better quality. But that's only in the last 5 minutes or so.
@KKafka - In a zombie apocalypse the last thing you think about is the type of camera you are using...

I was going to comment on the quality as well but didn't know the source was a low quality camera.

Plus, I read @localheroadam's comment.  :D
